standard_metadata.standard_description: Recognize that in a multi-digit whole number, a digit in one place represents ten times what it represents in the place to its right.

question.content: **Arrange the digits $6,0,1,$ and $2$ to create the greatest possible four-digit number.**

hints.content: We want to put the largest digit in the highest place value.   Which digit is the largest?
$\maroonD6$ is the largest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.       So $\maroonD6$ will be in the thousands place:   $\maroonD{6}{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$
Now we need to do the same thing with the next largest digit:  $\blueD2$.      So  $\blueD2$ goes in the hundreds place:    $\maroonD{6}{,}$$\blueD2$ $\_$ $\_$
The next largest digit is the $\greenD1$.  The $\greenD1$ goes in the place to the right of hundreds--the tens place:    $\maroonD{6}{,}$$\blueD2$$\greenD1$  $\_$

The smallest digit is the $\purpleC0$.  The  $\purpleC0$ goes in the ones place:    $\maroonD{6}{,}\blueD2\greenD1\purpleC0$  The greatest possible number we can make is $\maroonD{6}{,}\blueD2\greenD1\purpleC0$.

item.problemType: Type 3 - Create largest or smallest number

question.content: **Arrange the digits $8, 1, 4, 3,$ and $7$  to create the greatest possible five-digit number.**

hints.content: We want to put the largest digit in the highest place value.   Which digit is the largest?
$\maroonD8$ is the largest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.       So $\maroonD8$ will be in the ten thousands place:   $\maroonD{8}$ $\_{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$
Now we need to do the same thing with the next largest digit:  $\blueD7$.      So  $\blueD7$ goes in the thousands place:    $\maroonD{8}$$\blueD7{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$
We can continue placing the next largest digit  in the next largest place value until we have placed all five digits:  $\maroonD{8}$$\blueD7{,}$$431$
The greatest possible number we can make is $87{,}431$.

item.problemType: Type 3 - Create largest or smallest number

question.content: **Arrange the digits $2,4,$ and $9$ to create the greatest possible three-digit number.**

hints.content: We want to put the largest digit in the highest place value.   Which digit is the largest?
$\greenD9$ is the largest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.       So $\greenD9$ will be in the hundreds place:   $\greenD{9}$ $\_$ $\_$
Now we need to do the same thing with the next largest digit:  $\blueD4$.      So  $\blueD4$ goes in the tens place:    $\greenD{9}$$\blueD4$ $\_$
The smallest digit is the $\purpleC2$.  The  $\purpleC2$ goes in the ones place:    $\greenD{9}\blueD4\purpleC2$  The greatest possible number we can make is $\greenD{9}\blueD4\purpleC2$.

item.problemType: Type 3 - Create largest or smallest number

question.content: **Arrange the digits $5,1,2,1,$ and $5$  to create the greatest possible five-digit number.**

hints.content: We want to put the largest digit in the highest place value.   Which digit is the largest?
$\greenD5$ is the largest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.       So $\greenD5$ will be in the ten thousands place:   $\greenD{5}$ $\_{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$
Now we need to do the same thing with the next largest digit:  $\blueD5$.      So  $\blueD5$ goes in the thousands place:    $\greenD{5}\blueD5{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$
We can continue placing the next largest digit in the next largest place value until we have placed all five digits:  $\greenD{5}\blueD5{,}211$
The greatest possible number we can make is $55{,}211$.

The next largest digit is the $\greenD6$.  The $\greenD6$ goes in the place to the right of hundreds--the tens place:    $\maroonD{7}{,}$$\blueD6$$\greenD6$  $\_$

The smallest digit is the $\purpleC4$.  The  $\purpleC4$ goes in the ones place:    $\maroonD{7}{,}\blueD6\greenD6\purpleC4$  The greatest possible number we can make is $\maroonD{7}{,}\blueD6\greenD6\purpleC4$.

question.content: **Arrange the digits $6,0,3,2,$ and $4$  to create the greatest possible five-digit number.**

item.problemType: Type 3 - Create largest or smallest number

question.content: **Arrange the digits $1,9,6,2,7,$ and $4$  to create the greatest possible six-digit number.**

$\greenD9$ is the largest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.       So $\greenD9$ will be in the hundred thousands place:   $\greenD{9}$ $\_$ $\_{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$

We can continue placing the next largest digit in the next largest place value until we have placed all six digits:  $\greenD{9}\blueD76{,}421$
The greatest possible number we can make is $976{,}421$.

item.problemType: Type 3 - Create largest or smallest number

question.content: **Arrange the digits $2,9,8,9,$ and $5$  to create the lowest possible five-digit number.**

hints.content: We want to put the smallest digit in the greatest place value.   Which digit is the smallest?
$\maroonD2$ is the smallest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.       So $\maroonD2$ will be in the ten thousands place:   $\maroonD{2}$ $\_{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$
Now we need to do the same thing with the next smallest digit:  $\blueD5$.    So  $\blueD5$ goes in the thousands place:    $\maroonD{2}\blueD5{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$
We can continue placing the next smallest digit in the next largest place value until we have placed all five digits:  $\maroonD{2}\blueD5{,}899$
The smallest possible number we can make is $25{,}899$.

The next smallest digit is the $\purpleC3$.  The $\purpleC3$ goes in the place to the right of hundreds--the tens place:    $\maroonD{2}{,}\blueD3\purpleC3$  $\_$

The greatest digit is the $\greenD8$.  The  $\greenD8$ goes in the ones place:    $\maroonD{2}{,}\blueD3\purpleC3\greenD8$   The smallest possible number we can make is $\maroonD{2}{,}\blueD3\purpleC3\greenD8$.

We can continue placing the next smallest digit in the next largest place value until we have placed all five digits:  $\maroonD{4}\blueD6{,}678$
The smallest possible number we can make is $46{,}678$.

item.problemType: Type 1
